question_text: Which formula would you use for the amount of paint needed for a rectangular wall: Area or Volume?
A rectangular book cover has an area of 300 cm². You know its length is 20cm. Can you use a formula to find its width?
Which formula is used to find the amount of space a refrigerator takes up on the kitchen floor: Area or Volume?
The area of a rectangular poster is 500 cm². If you know its width is 20cm, what calculation will give you its length?
How many metres are in 3 kilometres?
A bag of flour weighs 2 kilograms. How many grams is that?
A bottle holds 4 litres of water. What is its capacity in millilitres?
A path is 5000 metres long. How many kilometres is this?
A parcel weighs 6000 grams. How many kilograms does it weigh?
A container holds 7000 millilitres of liquid. How many litres is this?
A fence is 2 metres long. How many centimetres is that?
A book is 300cm wide when opened flat. How many metres is this?

An insect is 20mm long. How many centimetres is this?

How many kilometres are in 10,000 metres?
How many kilograms are in 10,000 grams?

A road is 1km long. How many metres is this?
A weight is 1kg. How many grams is this?
A bottle holds 1L. How many millilitres is this?

An eraser is 4cm long. What is its length in mm?

What is 600 centimetres in metres?

A plank of wood is 1.5m long. How many centimetres is this?
A bag of apples weighs 1.2kg. What is this weight in grams?
A jug holds 2.5 litres of water. What is its capacity in millilitres?
A running race is 1500 metres long. What is this distance in kilometres?

A glass holds 250ml of juice. What is this capacity in litres?
A person's height is 175cm. How tall are they in metres?
A line is 45mm long. What is this length in centimetres?
Convert 0.5 kilometres into metres.
A parcel weighs 2.1kg. What is this weight in grams?
A carton contains 0.75 litres of milk. How many millilitres is this?
A bridge is 800m long. What is this distance in kilometres?
A small bag of crisps weighs 35g. What is this weight in kilograms?
A bottle holds 330ml. What is this volume in litres?
Convert 1.05 metres to centimetres.
Convert 6mm into centimetres.
How many grams are in 0.2 kilograms?
How many millilitres are in 1.95 litres?
A walk is 4.8km long. How many metres is this?
A baby weighs 3400g at birth. What is this weight in kilograms?
A car's engine is 1.6 litres. What is this in millilitres?
Convert 2.15 kilometres into metres.
How many kilometres is 350 metres?
A piece of wood is 1.8 metres long. How many millimetres is this?
An insect is 8mm long. What is this length in metres?
What is the total weight in kilograms of three items weighing 1.2kg, 800g, and 1.5kg?
A tank holds 50 litres. You remove 12,500ml. How many litres are left?
A runner completes a 10km race. They also did a 1500m warm-up. What was the total distance in km?
A book weighs 0.8kg. The packaging weighs 150g. What is the total postage weight in kilograms?
A bottle of shampoo is 0.4L. A smaller bottle is 250ml. What is the difference in capacity in litres?
A stack of 100 coins is 22cm high. What is the thickness of one coin in millimetres?
Convert 0.02 kilometres into centimetres.
A medicine dose is 5ml. A bottle contains 0.1 litres. How many doses are in the bottle?
What is the sum of 1.8m, 120cm, and 500mm in metres?
A bag of sugar weighs 1kg. A baker uses 350g. How many kilograms are left?
You pour 0.6L from a 2-litre bottle. How many millilitres are left?
How many 20cm pieces of ribbon can be cut from a 5-metre roll?
What is 450 grams as a decimal fraction of a kilogram?
A water tank holds 250 litres. 75,000ml are used. How many litres remain?
A builder buys 1 tonne (1000kg) of sand. He uses 450kg. How many kilograms are left?
Convert 1 minute and 15 seconds into hours as a decimal.
Convert 1 hour and 15 minutes into minutes.
A lorry travels 0.8km. How many centimetres is this?
How many grams are in 3.05 kilograms?
What is 50 centilitres in litres?
A car has a fuel efficiency of 15 km per litre. How many metres can it travel on 1 millilitre of fuel?
A box has a volume of 0.05 cubic metres. How many litres is this?
Convert a speed of 90 km/h into metres per second.
A water pipe has a flow rate of 0.2 litres per second. How many cubic metres of water flow through it in one hour?
What is the sum of 0.01km, 25m and 3500cm in metres?
What is the sum of 0.02km, 15m and 4500cm in metres?
A piece of metal has a density of 8 g/cm³. What is its density in kg/m³?
A map has a scale where 1cm represents 500m. A distance on the map is 8cm. What is the actual distance in kilometres?
A swimming pool measures 25m x 10m x 2m. How many litres of water does it hold?
A hectare is 10,000 square metres. A field is 0.5km by 0.2km. How many hectares is it?
A car's speed is 50 metres per second. Is this faster than the motorway speed limit of 70 mph? (1 mile ≈ 1609m)
Convert 1 cubic metre into millilitres.
A builder needs 0.75 cubic metres of concrete. He can mix 50 litres at a time. How many mixes will he need to make?
A piece of paper is 0.1mm thick. How high would a stack of one million pieces of paper be, in metres?
A cyclist travels at 30 km/h. How many metres do they travel in 10 seconds?
A water butt has a capacity of 200 litres. A roof collects rainwater at a rate of 0.5 litres per square metre per mm of rain. The roof area is 80 m². How many mm of rain must fall to fill the butt?
A light travels at 300,000 km per second. How far does it travel in a nanosecond (one billionth of a second)?
A box is 0.8m x 50cm x 300mm. What is its volume in litres?
A price for fabric is £5 per square metre. What is the price per square centimetre in pence?
What is one square kilometre in hectares?
A tonne is 1000kg. The density of water is 1000 kg/m³. What is the weight of 250ml of water in grams?
How many 200ml cups can you fill from a 0.1 cubic metre container of water?
A pipe's diameter is 5cm. Water flows through it at 2m/s. What is the flow rate in litres per minute? (Use π ≈ 3)
A pipe has a cross-sectional area of 10cm². Water flows at 2m/s. What is the flow rate in litres per minute?
Which is a metric unit for length: a metre or a yard?
Which is an imperial unit for mass: a gram or an ounce?
Which is a metric unit for volume: a millilitre or a fluid ounce?
Is an inch (unit of length) part of the metric or imperial system?
The pound (lb) is used for weight. Is it a metric or an imperial unit?
Pints are used to measure capacity. Are pints a metric or imperial unit of measurement?
Which is longer: 2 inches or 5 centimetres?
Which is heavier: 2 kilograms or 4 pounds?
Which holds more: 2 litres or 3 pints?
When looking at a ruler marked in centimetres and inches, which unit typically has smaller divisions or markings?
When you buy fuel for a car, you can choose between litres or gallons. Which is the metric unit?
You weigh yourself at the gym in kilograms. Is this a metric or imperial measurement?
If a recipe calls for 2 pounds of flour, is pounds a metric or an imperial unit?
Which is shorter: 1 metre or 1 yard?
Which holds less: a 1-litre bottle or a 2-pint bottle of milk?
In the UK, when measuring a person's height, which unit is more commonly used: metres (metric) or feet (imperial)?
When you see a speed limit sign in mph (miles per hour) in the UK, is miles a metric or imperial unit?
Which is a metric unit: a stone or a kilogram?
Which is an imperial unit: a metre or a foot?
Which is a shorter distance: 2 kilometres or 1 mile?
When measuring a TV screen in inches, is inches a metric or imperial unit?
When measuring a baby's weight in pounds and ounces, are these considered metric or imperial units?
Pints of beer are served in pubs. Is pint a metric or imperial measure?
When measuring a small object, which unit provides a more precise reading: centimetres or inches?
Which is a greater weight: 5 kilograms or 10 pounds?
1 inch is approximately 2.5cm. How many centimetres are in 2 inches?
1 kilogram is about 2.2 pounds. A dog weighs 10kg. What is its approximate weight in pounds?
1 litre is about 1.76 pints. You buy 2 litres of milk. Approximately how many pints is this?
A sign says a town is 5 miles away. If 1 mile is about 1.6km, how far is the town in kilometres?
If a person is 6 feet tall and 1 foot is approximately 30cm, what is their height in centimetres?
A car's petrol tank holds 10 gallons. If 1 gallon is about 4.5 litres, what is the tank's approximate capacity in litres?
Which is heavier: a 2kg bag of sugar or a 4-pound bag of apples? (1kg ≈ 2.2 lbs)
Which is a longer distance: a 10-mile run or a 15-kilometre run? (1 mile ≈ 1.6 km)
A ruler is 30cm long. Approximately how many inches is this? (1 inch ≈ 2.5cm)
A parcel weighs 11 pounds. What is its approximate weight in kilograms? (1kg ≈ 2.2 lbs)
You need 4 pints of milk for a recipe. How many 1-litre cartons do you need to buy? (1 litre ≈ 1.76 pints)
A road is 80km long. Approximately how many miles is this? (1 mile ≈ 1.6 km)
A person is 180cm tall. Approximately how many feet is this? (1 foot ≈ 30cm)
A tank holds 90 litres. Approximately how many gallons is this? (1 gallon ≈ 4.5 litres)
How many centimetres are in 6 inches? (1 inch ≈ 2.5cm)
A suitcase weighs 44 pounds. What is its approximate weight in kilograms? (1kg ≈ 2.2 lbs)
A bottle holds 1 pint of liquid. If 1 litre ≈ 1.76 pints, is the bottle more or less than half a litre?
A distance is 32km. What is this in miles? (1 mile ≈ 1.6 km)
How many feet are in 90cm? (1 foot ≈ 30cm)
How many litres are in 2 gallons? (1 gallon ≈ 4.5 litres)
Which is shorter: 50 inches or 120cm? (1 inch ≈ 2.5cm)
Which is lighter: 2 stone or 25kg? (1 stone ≈ 6.35 kg)
A recipe requires 4 ounces (oz) of sugar. If 1 oz is about 28g, how many grams do you need?
A car gets 40 miles per gallon. If 1 gallon is approximately 4.5 litres, what is its fuel efficiency in miles per litre?
If a room is 10 feet long, what is its approximate length in metres? (Use 1 foot ≈ 30.5cm)
A person weighs 11 stone. What is their approximate weight in kg? (1 stone = 14 lbs, 1 kg ≈ 2.2 lbs)
If something costs $50 per square foot, approximately what is the price per square metre? (Use 1 metre ≈ 3.3 feet)
If a speed is 60 miles per hour, convert this to kilometres per hour. (Use 1 mile ≈ 1.6 km)
Which is a faster speed: 70 mph or 120 km/h? (1 mile ≈ 1.6 km)
A US recipe needs 120g of flour. A UK recipe needs 4 ounces (1 oz ≈ 28g). Which recipe requires more flour?
Compare 2 metres with 6 feet 6 inches. Which length is greater? (Use 1 foot = 12 inches, 1 inch ≈ 2.5cm)
Convert 1 acre into square metres, using the approximation 1 acre ≈ 4047 m².
A car's petrol tank holds 12 gallons. If 1 gallon ≈ 4.5 litres and petrol costs £1.40 per litre, how much does it cost to fill the tank?
A car's speed limit is 50 mph. Estimate this speed in metres per second (m/s). (Use 1 mile ≈ 1600m)
You have a 2-litre bottle of water. You drink 2 pints. How much is left in litres? (1 litre ≈ 1.76 pints)
A package weighs 4 pounds and 8 ounces. What is its weight in kilograms? (1 kg ≈ 2.2 lbs)
If 1 metre ≈ 39 inches, approximately how many square inches are in 1 square metre?
A cyclist travels at 20 mph. Convert 50km to miles, then calculate the time to travel this distance. (1 mile ≈ 1.6km)
If a box has a volume of 2 cubic feet, what is its volume approximately in litres? (Use 1 foot ≈ 30cm and 1 litre = 1000cm³)
Which is a larger volume: 2 cubic metres or 70 cubic feet?
A weight is 15 pounds. A length is 10 inches. Can you convert this to kg/cm?
Convert a distance of 50km into miles. (Use 1 mile ≈ 1.6km)
Your height is 5 feet 8 inches. What is your height in metres? (1 inch ≈ 2.54cm)
Which has a greater area: a circle with a 12-inch diameter or a 1-foot square?
The temperature is 20°C. Convert this to Fahrenheit using F = (C × 9/5) + 32.
Which contains more liquid: a US quart (0.95 litres) or 2 pints (UK)? (1 UK pint = 568ml)
A suitcase is 50 pounds. The airline limit is 23 kilograms. Is the suitcase over the limit? (Use 1kg ≈ 2.2 lbs)
Compare a 100m rugby pitch to a 100-yard US football field. Which is longer? (Use 1 yard = 0.9144m)
A bag of sugar weighs 2.2 pounds. How many kg is this? (1kg = 2.2lb)
A journey is 50 miles. You complete the first 40km. How many miles are left? (1 mile ≈ 1.6km)
A race is 100km. A runner covers 30 miles. How many km does he have left to run? (1 mile ≈ 1.6km)
Which is a faster speed: 60 mph or 100 km/h? (1 mile ≈ 1.6km)
A road sign shows a town is 15 miles away. How far is that in km? (1 mile ≈ 1.6km)
A map uses a scale where 1cm represents 10 miles. If two towns are 8cm apart on the map, how far apart are they in km? (1 mile ≈ 1.6km)
A car's odometer shows 100,000 miles. How many km is this? (1 mile ≈ 1.6km)
The speed limit is 70 mph. What is this in km/h? (1 mile ≈ 1.6km)
A journey is 120km. You have 30 miles left to go. How far have you travelled in km? (1 mile ≈ 1.6km)
A race is 200 miles long. How many km is this? (1 mile ≈ 1.6km)
A river is 250km long. How many miles is this? (1 mile ≈ 1.6km)
Which is faster: 80 km/h or 50 mph? (1 mile ≈ 1.6km)
A flight covers 1,200 miles. How many km is this? (1 mile ≈ 1.6km)
A car has driven 80,000 km. How many miles is that? (1 mile ≈ 1.6km)
A cyclist rides 10 miles. Her friend rides 15 km. Who rode further? (1 mile ≈ 1.6km)
A map has a scale of 1:100,000. If a distance on the map is 5cm, how many km is the real distance?
A train travels at 120 mph. How many km/h is this? (1 mile ≈ 1.6km)
A GPS shows a destination is 25 miles away. You have 30km of fuel. Is that enough? (1 mile ≈ 1.6km)
A river is 30 miles long. What is its length in km? (1 mile ≈ 1.6km)
A marathon is 26.2 miles. How many km is this? (1 mile ≈ 1.6km)
A car uses 1 litre of fuel per 10km. How many litres will it use for a 50-mile journey? (1 mile ≈ 1.6km)
How many km is 1 mile and a half? (1 mile ≈ 1.6km)
A building is 0.5 miles tall. What is its height in km? (1 mile ≈ 1.6km)
Which is a longer distance: 10 miles or 16 km? (1 mile ≈ 1.6km)
A car has a speed limit of 100 km/h. How many miles per hour is this? (1 mile ≈ 1.6km)
A race is 20 miles. How many km is this? (1 mile ≈ 1.6km)
A journey takes 1 hour and 30 minutes. How many minutes is that?
A TV show is 90 minutes long. How many hours is this?
A car journey is 150km. How many miles is this? (1 mile ≈ 1.6km)
